body.p: When writing DITA content it is possible to use all kinds of references. For example it is possible to point to a link in the web using a href. For example . You can also point to another chapter. For example .

Really useful are key-based references (keyref). Basically you use an alias for the reference. This alias must be mapped within the ditamap. For example . This can be explicitly useful when content is made reusable. The reusable piece want's to introduce a reference. But the reference is dangling until the content is reused in a ditamap. Then the reference must of course exist. The ditamap has to specify how the link is to be resolved.
